Books for Girls

30 Jul 2012

Robin McKinley

Unlike the other items on this list, this is an author, not a particular book. That’s because every single one of her books has a shining example of a fantastic female character. Pick any of them, or, even better, all of them. You can’t go wrong. Start with:

Beauty http://www.amazon.com/Beauty-Retelling-Story-Beast/dp/0060241497

The Blue Sword http://www.amazon.com/The-Blue-Sword-Robin-McKinley/dp/0688009387/

The Hero and the Crown http://www.amazon.com/The-Hero-Crown-Robin-McKinley/dp/0688025935/

The Outlaws of Sherwood http://www.amazon.com/Outlaws-Sherwood-Robin-McKinley/dp/0441013252/ A good, old-fashioned adventure tale about Robin Hood, and Marian kicks ass in it.

Save Deerskin and Sunshine for when she’s a little older.

The Nancy Drew Series, by Caroline Keene http://www.amazon.com/Nancy-Drew-Mystery-Stories-Staircase/dp/044809570X/

Coraline, by Neil Gaiman http://www.amazon.com/Coraline-Neil-Gaiman/dp/0380807343/

Ella Enchanted, by Gail Carson Levine http://www.amazon.com/Ella-Enchanted-Newbery-Honor-Book/dp/0060275103/

Little Women, by Louisa May Alcott http://www.amazon.com/Little-Collectors-Library-Louisa-Alcott/dp/1907360212/

Emily of New Moon, by L.M. Montgomery http://www.amazon.com/Emily-New-Moon-Novels/dp/055323370X/

From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler, by E.L. Konigsberg http://www.amazon.com/Mixed-up-Files-Mrs-Basil-Frankweiler/dp/1416949755/

The Chronicles of Prydain, by Lloyd Alexander http://www.amazon.com/Chronicles-Prydain-Boxed-Set/dp/1250000939/

Matilda, by Roald Dahl http://www.amazon.com/Matilda-Roald-Dahl/dp/0142410373/

Not One Damsel in Distress: World Folktales for Strong Girls, by Jane Yolen http://www.amazon.com/Not-One-Damsel-Distress-Folktales/dp/0152020470/

Catherine Called Birdy, by Karen Cushman http://www.amazon.com/Catherine-Called-Birdy-Trophy-Newbery/dp/0780748433/

Pride and Prejudice, by Jane Austen http://www.amazon.com/Pride-Prejudice-Norton-Critical-Editions/dp/0393976041/

The Gemma Doyle Series, by Libba Bray http://www.amazon.com/Gemma-Doyle-Trilogy-Terrible-Beauty/dp/B0051R48JQ/

Boyproof, by Cecil Castellucci http://www.amazon.com/Boy-Proof-Cecil-Castellucci/dp/B004JZX2Q6/

The Plain Janes http://www.amazon.com/Plain-Janes-Minx-Cecil-Castellucci/dp/1401211151/

Sunshine, by Robin McKinley http://www.amazon.com/Sunshine-Robin-McKinley/dp/0142411108/ As previously mentioned. If you know a teenage girl leaning towards Twilight, please, please, please, put Sunshine in her path instead. It’s a vampire tale, but with a smart, strong female lead and not a hint of
